title: Stuart Davis Memorial Exhibition
description: This Stuart Davis memorial exhibition honored Davis himself, who had died less than a year prior to it’s exhibition. It held over 120 works, and aimed to pay tribute to Davis as one of the most “American painters” in contemporary art. Davis, who was born into a family of painters, produced art that ranged from American Realism to abstract to work that aligned him with the American Jazz Age. In the show, works that showed his dynamic progression from his early years through his later years were featured.
